items.sentence: I first met Tom at a football game in Boston.
When I was your age, I had to walk to school.
Tom promised Mary he would do what she asked.
Tom spent quite a lot of money for his house.
Tom told his parents that he had no homework.
Tom doesn\'t seem to be interested in sports.
Tom doesn\'t seem to be making much progress.
Tom doesn\'t seem to have been injured badly.
Tom doesn\'t seem to know very much about us.
Tom returned to his room and closed the door.
Tom said I was the only one who believed him.
Tom didn\'t do what he\'s being punished for.
Please be careful not to let the dog outside.
Please limit your presentation to 30 minutes.
I was pretty sure that Tom wouldn\'t do that.
I was sick, so I couldn\'t go to the concert.
We won\'t do what Tom said he wants us to do.
We have to be more aware of what\'s going on.
You aren\'t allowed to take photographs here.
You can\'t back out of your responsibilities.
